title: 112_hr5683
content:
The "Veterans' Job Corps Act" establishes and operates the Veterans' Job Corps. The President may establish a Veterans' Job Corps to provide employment opportunities for veterans and widows, focusing on public works related to forestation, forest fire prevention, public safety, plant pest control, and maintenance of national parks and public lands. The President may utilize Federal agencies like the Department of the Interior, Agriculture, and Veterans Affairs to operate the Veterans' Job Corps, which can extend its activities to lands owned by political subdivisions or private owners for cooperation work authorized by law. The President may enter into contracts or agreements necessary to carry out the Act and acquire real property for projects by purchase, donation, or other means. SEC. 3. ADMINISTRATION OF VETERANS' JOB CORPS. The President shall employ individuals in the Veterans' Job Corps in the following order of preference: unemployed veterans and widows eligible for unemployment compensation. The President may provide housing, subsistence, clothing, medical care, and transportation for employees of the Veterans' Job Corps. Exclusion criteria for employment under the Act include individuals convicted of a felony and veterans discharged from the Armed Forces under dishonorable conditions. SEC. 4. USE OF FUNDS.

The President can use unobligated funds for public works to establish and operate a Veterans' Job Corps, with at least 75 percent of the funds used for employment under this Act. Amounts appropriated for this Act remain available until expended.

SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS.

In this Act, "veteran" is defined as in section 101(2) of title 38, United States Code. The term "widow" refers to the spouse of a veteran who has not remarried after the veteran's death, including widowers.

SEC. 6. TERMINATION.

The President's authority to establish and operate a Veterans' Job Corps under this Act expires on September 30, 2018.
